s1.name: Administration
s1.p: Tony Thompson has started to work on the configuration of a JORAM platform. His goal is to get rid of the current static configuration way based on a XML file, by allowing to start a server in a minimum configuration state and configure it through administration methods. Tony has suspended his work but hopefully will be able to resume soon!
Monitoring capabilities have been added by Frédéric Maistre (INRIA). They allow to:

ul.li: get a list of destinations for a given server;
get a list of users for a given server;
get a list of readers or writers for a given destination;
get the number of subscibers on a given topic;
get the number of pending messages on a given queue;
get the number of pending "receive" requests on a given queue;
retrieve the dead message queue related settings for a given server, destination or user.

s1.p: Alexander Fedorowicz is developing a graphical interface and will soon be able to propose a first version of his work.

s1.name: kJoram
s1.p: Nicolas Tachker (ScalAgent) is developing a light Joram client portable on the J2ME environment (kJoram). This client will connect to the Joram platform through Enhydra's kSoap protocol. The SOAP proxy introduced by the joram 3.4 release is the kSoap entry point for the Joram platform.

s1.name: Persistence
s1.p: Frédéric Maistre (INRIA) is re-viewing the persistence implementation in the Joram platform, mainly for improving the performances of the persistent mode.
Gavin King is working to provide a new persistence mode using JDBC and allowing to set a database as persistence support.
